    This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

GET

Bag O' Links - 19/11/2009

  • IE9 early look for developers – OH… SHINY ROUND CORNERES….who cares?! the comment that states “why don’t they just copy the webkit engine? it’s open source” says it all.
  • #hash method in Ruby – Neeraj points out a nice method that gives you a way to get an object footprint.
  • Full tracing of Internet Explorer – Resig is digging into Internet Explorer, sounds like a fun tour.
  • Experiences deploying a large-scale infrastructure in Amazon EC2 – good tips on how to pre-plan your application deployment and horizontal scaling agenda.
  • Deploying spree on Heroku – an easy tutorial on how to easily move your e-commerce site to Heroku from whatever diabolic shared hosting you currently rely on. (note: i’m totally in-love with heroku).
  • Semantic HTML templates – avoid <div>iditis, enjoy the fresh air of semantic structure.
  • Nginx gets a push module – yeah…ok. :)
  • 25 tips for Git users – title says “intermediate”, i think everyone should read.
  • Express – Sinatra style javascript – that is nice! a sinatra like V8 based “server-side” javascript library.
  • Narwal – another server-side javascript solution.
  • your stack trace is precious! – tips from the awesome barking iguana.
  • Key-Value store in Ruby: wrap up – EY’s series on Ruby KV storage is over, excellent read.
  • 10 quick tips from EBay on scaling – the presentation is here.
  • cool linux projects to do – nice ideas, if you have some spare time.
  • command line ninja tricks for geeks – cool stuff.
  • jungle disk – cheap and simple backup solution, i love it.

Treasures

  • capybara – webrat alternative which aims to support all browser simulators
  • easy_esi – Rails: Cached pages with dynamic partials == Easy ESI
  • timeline_fu – a rails plugin that manages an activity stream, fits social networks and such.
  • godlike – enjoy the calming voice of the UT announcer when your autotest cycle passes with no failures/errors.
  • sinatra-mvc – a nice attempt to show some MVC conventions into sinatra.
  • cucumber_textmate – Custom formatter for cucumber, creates pretty html output and JS for textmate similar to the rspec html output.
  • term_extraction – extract related terms and tags for a word or a phrase.
  • dead_simple_report – create reports via sql or ruby code for your rails app in minutes.
  • DJ stats – reporting module for delayed_job.
  • AccessControl – pin-pointed permission management for Rails. looks nice.
